summary.seg: This pocket-sized manuscript is an example of a service book for the Holy Week liturgy for personal use. It contains the mainly the Morning service of Easter Saturday, along with a threnos (lament) of the Virgin, a hymn by George Acropolites (13th century) for Easter Saturday, and an idiomelon (hymn) from the office of Easter Friday. It was used by an unknown priest Stylianos Moulianos, who added some text and his name on f. 87r. In the mid-18th century, the manuscript was probably used in Italy or by a reader with Italian connections: an account, with a number of Italian names, of an incident that occurred during the Easter of 1743, where many people lost their lives, was added at the end of the manuscript, perhaps by Stylianos Moulianos. Moreover, on the first folio has been glued the printed image of Jesus carrying the cross, with a title in Latin. The manuscript was donated to Cambridge University Library by M.R. James in 1893.

msItem.title: Great Doxology from the office of Easter Saturday
msItem.incipit: f. 1v ὁ δὲ ἱερεὺς ἀλλάσσει ἅπασαν τὴν ἱερατικήν στολήν
msItem.explicit: f. 5r αἱ λοιπαί λιταί ὡσαύτως ἐν τῷ νάρθηκι ψάλλονται

msItem.title: Threnos to the Virgin
msItem.rubric: f. 7r Θρῆνος εἰς τὴν ὑπεραγίαν θεοτόκον
msItem.incipit: f. 7r Παρισταμένη τῷ σταυρῷ, ἡ πάναγνος παρθένος
msItem.explicit: f. 14v σὺ γὰρ ἐλπὶς Χριστιανῶν ὑπάρχεις παναγία
msItem.note: Doxology added by a later hand

msItem.title: Morning office of Easter Saturday
msItem.rubric: f. 15r Ἀκολουθία τῷ ἁγίῳ καὶ μεγάλῳ σαββάτῳ ἐν τῷ ὄρθρῳ μετὰ τὸν ἐξέψαλμον θεὸς κυριός καὶ ἐπέφανεν ἡμῖν εἰς ἦχον βʹ τροπάριον ἦχος βʹ
msItem.incipit: f. 15r Ὁ εὐσχήμων Ἰωσὴφ ἀπὸ τοῦ ξύλου καθελὼν
msItem.explicit: f. 84v καὶ νῦν ὑπερευλογημένη· Δοξολογία μεγάλη

msItem.author: Akropolites, Georgios, 1217-
msItem.title: Carmen in magnum sabbatum
msItem.rubric: f. 84v τινὲς δὲ ἀντὶ τὸ ὄπισθεν δοξαστικὸν ψάλλουσιν τὸ παρὸν. ἦχος πλάγιος βʹ
msItem.incipit: f. 84v Τὸν ἥλιον κρύψαντα τὰς ἰδίας ἀκτῖνας
msItem.explicit: f. 86v τοῖς πιστοῖς παρεχόμενος ζωὴν αἰώνιον καὶ τὸ μέγα ἔλεος
msItem.note: Attributed by a later hand to Symeon of Thessalonike, and a different later hand added οὐ Μεταφράστου

msItem.title: Ιdiomelon from the office of Easter Friday
msItem.rubric: f. 86v Δόξα, καὶ νῦν ἦχος πλάγιος αʹ
msItem.incipit: f. 86v Σὲ τὸν ἀναβαλλόμενον, τὸ φῶς ὥσπερ ἱμάτιον
msItem.explicit: f. 87r σὺν τῇ ἀναστάσει κραυγάζων κύριε δόξα σοι

msItem.title: Excerpts from the offices (almost illegible)
msItem.incipit: f. 87r ὁ δι' ἡμᾶς τοὺς ἀνθρώπους, καὶ διὰ τὴν ἡμετέραν σωτηρίαν
msItem.explicit: f. 88r καταδεξάμενος διὰ τὴν ἡμετέραν σωτηρίαν

msItem.title: An account of an incident at Easter 1743
msItem.incipit: f. 89r 1743 ἀπριλίου ἐσκότωσαν οἱ ποταμίται εἰς τὸ κασσόπι
msItem.explicit: f. 89r καὶ τὸν ἔθαψαν εἰς τὸν ἅγιον βάρβαρον, εἰς τὸν ποταμὸν

support.material: Paper, folded in sexto-decimo. Watermark: two letters (BB) ( 20 30 ) on lower margin ff. 9, 16 and 42.

supportDesc.foliation: 1-90. The leaves are foliated in pencil in Arabic numerals in the upper right-hand corner, recto.
Foliation in brown ink in Greek numerals, in the upper right-hand corner, recto, from α to ον, starting from f. 15r, ending at f. 87r, in all likelihood by Stylianos Moulianos.

collation.p:
The manuscript consists of 10 quaternions:
6 endleaves ff. 1r-6v
Quire 18-1 ff. 7r-13v
Quires 2-78 ff. 14r-61v
Quire 88-1 ff. 62r-68v
Quires 9-108 ff. 69r-84v
6 endleaves ff. 85r-90v
collation.catchwords: Catchwords are written horizontally on verso folios in right-hand lower margin.
collation.signatures: Quire signature, original to the production, in red ink in Greek numerals in the lower centre of the first folio, recto. Mostly lost to trimming it survives on ff. 14r βʹ, 22r γ ον, 38r εʹ (δʹ struck out), 45v (last folio of the quire) εʹ, and δʹ in brown ink, 46r ϛʹ, 69r θʹ, 77r ιʹ.

supportDesc.condition: In fair condition, with extensive pest damage. There is some extensive mould staining with some white accretions on ff. 87v and 88r, almost illegible as one has blotted the other. Two loose pieces of paper remain between ff. 67v and 68r, and 87v and 88r. Paper strips have been used in the gutter and some of the repairs (e.g. f. 54v) bears manuscript musical notations.

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 7r-86v:
104 75
Main text between 13 and 16 lines per page.

handNote.p: The main text has been copied in a calligraphic Hodegon-style mixed minuscule script, slanting slightly to the right, in brown and red ink. There is moderate variation in letter size.

Syllabic abbreviations and superscript word endings are not in use. Breathings are curved and mute iota is present, with frequent decorative use of the double dot on ypsilon and accentuation of all nomina sacra.
Punctuation used includes the middle and upper points, lower commas and full stop.
ff. 1r-5r, 14v, 86v-89r. Informal slanting mixed minuscule script by Stylianos Moulianos in brown ink.
Occasional annotations, e.g. ff. 25v-33r, 87r by Hand C in an informal slanting mixed minuscule script in black ink.

decoDesc.decoNote: Cord headpiece coloured in red on f. 7r
The thick red-ink major initials on ff. 70v, 72r, 83v, 84v.
Minor initials written in a thin red-ink uncial within the body of the text.

additions.p: Two illustrations pasted in: f. 1r Christus calvaria petens, f. 15r drawing of the Laying out of Christ in the tomb, coloured in blue and red.

binding.p: Light brown skin binding. The left board is made of printed waste. There are four fake cords stuck on the inner side of the parchment spine. The two parchment straps and their metal component are still present and attached to the right board with a metallic nail. The catchplates on the left board are lost, some metallic nail remnants remain.

history.origin: The style of script suggest that the manuscript was written likely not before the 16th century.

provenance.p: Belonged in the 18th century to Stylianos Moulianos, who added the great doxology on f. 1v and probably the account on f. 89r of an incident occurring at Easter 1743. Stylianos Moulianos is probably the copyist and owner of Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Supplément grec 1307 .

history.acquisition:
Presented to the University Library in 1893 by
Montague Rhodes James (1862-1936) James, M.R. (Montague Rhodes), 1862-1936 .

recordHist.source: Description based on P. Easterling, Hand-list of the additional Greek manuscripts in the University Library, Cambridge, in: Scriptorium 16, 1962, pp. 302-323: 309, and unpublished description by R.V. Kerr, Under-Librarian of CUL († 1987).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card. For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Joining the Library). For further information on the availability of the manuscript, please contact the Manuscripts Reading Room.

analytic.title: Hand-list of the additional Greek manuscripts in the University Library, Cambridge
